993.quote: What I loved about 'Summer' was that they were these four bright kids with a wonderful future. In a way, she was the one with the brains, and then you have the beauty queen and the jock and the introvert.
993.author: Kevin Williamson

994.quote: Life stands before me like an eternal spring with new and brilliant clothes.
994.author: Carl Friedrich Gauss

995.quote: My family is just an amazing melting pot of wonderful religions and faiths.
995.author: Rima Fakih

996.quote: It is the paradox of life that the way to miss pleasure is to seek it first. The very first condition of lasting happiness is that a life should be full of purpose, aiming at something outside self.
996.author: Hugo Black

997.quote: If you choose not to pursue your dreams, you'll still be a part of a dream - only it will be someone else's.
997.author: Mike Hawkins

998.quote: I'm gonna be making records anyway, even if I had to sell 'em out of the trunk of my car. I'm that kind of musician and singer.
998.author: Dolly Parton

999.quote: If at first you don't succeed, blame your parents.
999.author: Marcelene Cox

1000.quote: I know only that what is moral is what you feel good after and what is immoral is what you feel bad after.
1000.author: Ernest Hemingway

1001.quote: Discipline is based on pride, on meticulous attention to details, and on mutual respect and confidence. Discipline must be a habit so ingrained that it is stronger than the excitement of the goal or the fear of failure.
1001.author: Gary Ryan Blair

1002.quote: Courage that grows from constitution often forsakes a man when he has occasion for it courage which arises from a sense of duty acts in a uniform manner.
1002.author: Addison, Joseph

1003.quote: It looks good when you see someone kicking at the age of 51 with no double. It's kinda cool for people to know that past 50 we can keep flexible.
1003.author: Jean Claude Van Damme

1004.quote: The function of prayer is not to influence God, but rather to change the nature of the one who prays.
1004.author: Soren Kierkegaard

1005.quote: There are only three things that can kill a farmer: lightning, rolling over in a tractor, and old age.
1005.author: Bill Bryson

1006.quote: I don't believe in God but I'm very interested in her.
1006.author: Arthur C. Clarke
